abstract: Former Moscow Mayor Yuri M Luzhkov has delivered series of verbal broadsides at high-ranking officials in Russia's governing United Russia party, apparently in an effort to echo public frustrations with Russia's ruling elite and to present himself as a political martyr; Luzhkov was abruptly dismissed from his position by Pres Dmitri A Medvedev in 2010.
snippet: Yuri M. Luzhkov, the former mayor of Moscow, has become a critic of the Kremlin and the ruling party, United Russia, apparently in an effort to echo public frustrations with Russia’s elite.
lead_paragraph: Yuri M. Luzhkov, the former mayor of Moscow, has become a critic of the Kremlin and the ruling party, United Russia, apparently in an effort to echo public frustrations with Russia’s elite.

headline.main: Thorn in Kremlin’s Side, Moscow Mayor Grows Even Sharper After His Dismissal
headline.print_headline: Thorn in Kremlin’s Side, Moscow Mayor Grows Even Sharper After His Dismissal
